articles.title: Curiosity Had to Route Around a 23-Degree Slope to Reach a Fascinating Field of Craters - Universe Today
articles.description: The Mars Curiosity rover made quite a climb through some slippery, rock terrain as it explored Jau on the slopes of Mount Sharp.
articles.content:
It’s hard to believe, but Mars Curiosity Rover has been on Mars doing its thing for 11 years. And, so what’s it doing to celebrate? Heading up a hill, making one of its toughest climbs ever.

articles.title: Flexibility Enabled Success of Trilobites, New Research Suggests - Sci.News
